sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's Tuesday the 21st of December and you're watching Euronews now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Omicron fears spread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization urges people to cancel Christmas events and celebrate later.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Prisons for rent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After struggling with overcrowding in its cells, Denmark pays Albania 20 million euros to relocate its inmates. And as Turkey, Iran and Russia begin another effort for peace in Syria, we'll talk to an expert about Europe's role in finding a solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: millions across Europe are hoping for a festive time this weekend with family and friends but for the second year running this could be in doubt the World Health Organization is recommending

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: canceling events over the holiday period in the light of growing cases of the Omicron variant of coronavirus worldwide. It's a message few want to hear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: All of us are sick of this pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: All of us want to spend time with friends and family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But an event cancelled is better than a life cancelled. It's better to cancel now and celebrate later than to celebrate now and grieve later. None of us want to be here again in 12 months' time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But for most governments, the focus is on booster campaigns or considering possible lockdowns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Netherlands is already in one of those. Switzerland has announced tight new Covid measures from December the 20th, including making working from home mandatory for all those who can. To be honest, I find it a bit difficult with the topic of vaccination. Now you're vaccinated and have the feeling that it's good, but somehow you notice that it still doesn't help that much. In Germany, federal and state governments are considering contact restrictions after Christmas even for the vaccinated and recovering individuals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For example, you can reduce the size of groups. In Bavaria, they have already closed bars and clubs for the upcoming days and weeks to avoid hotspots and super spreading events." Meanwhile Germany's new chancellor Olaf Scholz says the country will reach its target of offering booster shots to at least 30 million citizens by the end of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Kosovo has reached a deal to rent 300 of its jail cells to Denmark, an unusual move that will cost Copenhagen an annual fee of 20 million euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Authorities say this is to ease overcrowding in the Scandinavian country's prison system, as jail population has had a 20 percent jump.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Inmates sent to Kosovo will be foreigners, subject to deportation after serving their sentences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The intention is that the prisoners that will serve their sentence here in Kosovo will be prisoners that are expelled from from Denmark by the court of law and there will be of course a talk about which which prisoners this will entail but we have already talked about that there will be transfers, no, that are convicted to terror, no, that are convicted to war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Non-profit organizations monitoring the correctional system in Kosovo have said other prisons will naturally be overpopulated in order to make way for the incoming prisoners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: overpopulated in order to make way for the incoming prisoners. In Raqqa, Syria, the former de facto capital of ISIS, the scars of the fighting are easy

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: to see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: It's been 10 years since the war in Syria began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The 17th round of the Astana peace process is underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Russia, Turkey, Iran, the Syrian government and opposition all sent delegations. However, the West is absent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: No outside powers of the major donor countries like the United States or the European Union wishes to engage in the reconstruction process to fund that because they do not wish to give the regime any means of support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: So in many ways, the situation is stuck.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The UN estimates at least 350,000 people have been killed overall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: With issues such as refugees, the release of detainees, a humanitarian crisis and the possible regrouping of ISIS cells.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The delegates will have much to consider at these talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Slovenia is struggling with crime in its partially neglected Roma villages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Due to an increased number of thefts and vandalism, the police are implementing intensive controls with the help of horseback units and Roma police officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I don't know.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our family doesn't steal, but I'm not responsible for the others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Residents and businessmen from the industrial area Dobruškavas of Škocjan have urged the authorities to restore order because of they say unbearable conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The Roma are damaging other people's property, slashing tires, stealing from the crop fields, making open fires and there's a lot of noise disturbance in the Roma settlements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Mayor Jože Kappler has repeatedly urged the government to take action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: JOŽE KAPPLER, Mayor of Dobruškava, In fact, it's difficult for Roma to get jobs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: But if the state would create some social enterprise for them to join, there would be visible progress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: JOSÉ KAPPLER, Mayor of Dobruškava, The NGO Amnesty International estimates that 11,000 Roma people live in Slovenia, most of them in isolated settlements or slums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Seven years ago, a Roma family from the Dobruškava settlement complained to the European Court of Human Rights about the lack of access to water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The mayor of the municipality has provided us with water, but we also need electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Europe, half of Roma children and youth are not in education.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to the Dobruškava's authorities, few Roma girls attend high school and teenage pregnancy levels are high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: To convince Roma parents of the value of education, the Slovenian Ministry of the Interior plans to cut social benefits for those who do not comply with mandatory schooling. We want to change the law to ensure that parents lose this money if their children do not go to school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to an EU report, Roma adolescents can become easy targets for those who induce them to commit crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Although in this municipality there are still tensions as well as criminal acts, hopes remain that one day these two ethnic groups will finally get along.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechberger, Euronews, Dobruškava, Slovenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people filled the center of Buenos Aires on day two of rallies marking the 20th anniversary of Argentina's so-called great crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: 39 people were killed in a government crackdown during protests over economic meltdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It led to the resignation of the then president Fernando de la Rua, who fled the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The jury has begun its deliberations in Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking trial in New York. The prosecution earlier closed its arguments calling the girlfriend of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein a sophisticated predator.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The defence insists Maxwell is being made a scapegoat for the crimes of the late Epstein, who killed himself in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The verdict is expected before Christmas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: In a neighbourhood of Barcelona, parents have created an initiative to reclaim the city's busy roads and promote green and safe travel for children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: We need more bike lanes and they need to be safer. There are bike lanes but they are not so safe because there are some that go in the middle of the road or on the side. We need fewer cars and more bikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Launched in September, the roads in the area are now closed every Friday to cars, allowing children to bike to school with accompanying adults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: And just like a bus, they pick up schoolmates along the way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: As well as teaching children about the importance of sport and low-impact transport, the initiative has also highlighted the importance of improving how the city works for children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The cycling infrastructure is designed for people who are alone and who have a certain ability on a bike, not for boys and girls who have just started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The bike lanes are all on the road.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They're very close to the streets where cars travel very fast and where motorcycles also get too close. The infrastructure isn't suitable for children who have just learned to cycle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The cycling scheme has been a huge success, so much so that it has generated international interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And other neighbourhoods in the Catalan capital are also looking to replicate it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Omicron is now the dominant COVID-19 variant in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: And it has people concerned ahead of the holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Most states have cases confirmed, with Florida and Washington the current hotspots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think I'm glad to see that people are getting tests. If they're going to travel, I assume that's part of the reason why they're doing it with the upcoming holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it's also probably because a lot of people are starting to not feel very well with the new Omicron variant. So I'm a little it's disappointing and heart. It's like it's mixed emotions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There is speculation the U.S. is headed for lockdown with President Joe Biden due to make a speech on Omicron later on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: This is not a speech about locking the country down. This is a speech outlining and being direct and clear with the American people about the benefits of being vaccinated, the steps we're going to take to increase access and to increase testing and the risks posed to unvaccinated individuals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The top pandemic adviser Anthony Fauci is certainly on message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: If we do what we have been recommending very repetitively and intensively. Vaccination, booster, mitigation with masks in congregate settings, and over time we feel confident that we will get this under control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: US experts say vaccinations cannot protect completely against infection, but can reduce hospitalizations and deaths.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Poland and Lithuania has joined Ukraine in a call for stronger Western sanctions against Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: This comes amid a Russian troop built up near the Ukrainian border, fueling fears of an invasion possibly as early as next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The leaders met with President Volodymyr Zelensky in a show of support in the face of what they describe as ongoing aggression against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Together, the premiers signed a joint treaty aimed at prioritizing their common security and economic interests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Zelensky said, our shared task is to contain the threat, to protect Europe from aggressive Russian policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Today, Ukraine, Poland and Lithuania are at the forefront of this containment. task is to contain the threat, to protect Europe from aggressive Russian policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Today, Ukraine, Poland and Lithuania are at the forefront of this containment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: U.S. intelligence officials say Russia has amassed 70,000 troops near its border with Ukraine, while U.S. President Joe Biden has already warned that Russia would face severe consequences if Moscow attacked its neighbor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin continues to deny any plan of attack, but says it will respond in kind if NATO deploys missiles capable of reaching Russia in a few minutes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Let's talk a bit now more about that Lublin Triangle summit. Joining me now is Peter

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Dickinson. He is the Ukraine editor at the Atlantic Council. Peter, thank you for joining us here at Euronews. The Lublin Triangle draws on its historic ties, but what can Poland and Lithuania realistically do for Ukraine?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's limited what Poland and Lithuania can bring to the table. Obviously, neither are major, either military or economic powers, but they were able yesterday and have been able consistently in recent times to show solidarity with Ukraine, which is very welcome here in Kiev at the moment with the large Russian military buildup on the border and also in light of the hesitant approach that we're seeing from some other European countries, notably West European countries, where there is a resistance to moving forward with sanctions threats against Russia, where there are still a lot of people who are saying we need to look to dialogue rather than to entering into confrontation with the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So the position that was expressed yesterday by the leaders of Lithuania and Poland was very welcome from a Ukrainian point of view, in that they said unambiguously that they oppose any compromises with the Kremlin, they are against policies of so-called appeasement, and they want to see a much tougher stance, including perhaps even pre preemptive sanctions against Russia as this buildup continues and as the threat of a major escalation in the conflict between Russia and Ukraine continues to grow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And we're entering what is considered to be a danger period now, so with the winter freeze of the ground obviously making it potentially ideal for offensive operations. So this was a very welcome message and very welcome symbol of a show of solidarity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Global shares have bounced back after a sell-off on Monday amid fears of the Omicron variant, inflation and various other factors hitting the world economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Markets in Europe also saw an increase and US futures were up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Global leaders are grappling though with the needs of the economy versus health concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many countries have seen cases snowballing just this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now to get more on the economic picture in Europe, I'm joined by our business editor, Sasha Vakulina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sasha, we've seen a slight upturn today, but we're in a very unpredictable scenario. What is the picture like as the pandemic shows no signs of slowing down? It is truly unpredictable. What we've seen over the past few days when it comes to the global stock markets, that's of course, lots and lots of panic. Now, as all of us, we somehow thought and hoped that by the end of the year, we're going to be out of this pandemic stage, but we're not with Omicron, of course, spreading so fast everywhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So this is exactly those concerns that are translated there in the stock market. When it comes to the economy, when it comes to the European economy, the euro area, now I truly think that 2021 was not actually such a bad year, it was definitely better than 2020. What happened and what we saw was somehow a surprising resilience of the European economy and how it bounced back and it did bounce back after all the losses of 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There was something that not even politicians, European Central Bank actually expected to be happening, to be seeing there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We saw the economies reopening, we saw the businesses restarting. We saw people going back to work, people going back to travel. And that happened really, really quickly. That's really good news. The other thing, of course, is also because that rebound happened that significantly, we also saw this being translated not in the best way to the inflation in the euro area so many leaders are challenged with the conundrum of inflation in this as we said it's an unpredictable scenario so what sort of contingencies do the ecb have in place now that's interesting because of course the european central bank as other central banks and regulators they stepped in at very very early stages of the pandemic and of the kov19 economic crisis, trying to do their best to support the economies. But when it comes to the European Central Bank, its only mandate is actually price stability, and that's inflation. The ECB wants to see the inflation at 2%. The latest one is 4.9% in November. That's, of course, more than a double. We're not really seeing that coming down soon. We're not really seeing that coming down soon. We do expect to have better inflation towards the end better in terms of the ECB and going down towards the end of next year. So which means of course with the supply and demand situation and the rebound and the continuing economic crisis and the health crisis we are in the high inflation territory for at least half a year now. The ECB will have to do something but they will have to do it very very carefully because what they don't want to do they do not want to start raising the rates in order to achieve that price stability and calm down the inflation. If that would hurt the economic growth.. For the first time ever in the history of Dakar, an entirely female team will compete

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: in January's racing event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: With Mercè Marti and Margot Joubera behind the wheel and only female mechanics behind the scenes, the FN Speed Team are ready to take on one of the world's toughest rallies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: For everyone involved it's an opportunity for women to be at the forefront of the sport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The main project is to have visibility, a project made and led by women. We know that there are being drivers, co-drivers, but never a whole team. And I think this is a good opportunity to give visibility in one of the biggest platforms of motorsport and they encourage to other girls to be mechanics and to be part of this adventure." The 44th edition of the endurance rally will take place in Saudi Arabia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The grueling course over deserts and mountains is more than 8,000 kilometers long.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The pair will head out at the end of December and the race is expected to take place from the 1st to the 14th of January. for now, but do stay with us as we bring you all the latest from across Europe and beyond. You can also find more on our website euronews.com.
